definition: profitable to both sides/a win-win situation

sentences.english: Bottom line, you bring in revenue for them, you win, they win.
sentences.chinese: 底线就是，你为他们带来收入，大家双赢。

sentences.english: He called for negotiationson a “win-win solution”.
sentences.chinese: 他呼吁协商达成“双赢的解决方案”。

sentences.english: If building a win-win relationship, you can create an environment that solve the territorial issue.
sentences.chinese: 如能构筑双赢关系，则可以为解决领土问题创造环境。

sentences.english: You are welcome to be our distributor and make the dual win future of our enterprises.
sentences.chinese: 诚征区域经销商，共同创造企业双赢的未来。

sentences.english: If politics is taken out of the picture, the situation is win-win.
sentences.chinese: 如果撇开政治的影响，这可以使个双赢的局面。
李银珩说“这是一个双赢的成果”。

sentences.english: They are willing to continue to deepen the bilateral and multilateral cooperation for mutual benefit.
sentences.chinese: 愿不断深化双边与多边合作，实现互利双赢多赢。

sentences.english: Either you succeed or you learn something. Win-Win.
sentences.chinese: 或许成功，或许你从中学贤宫都是双赢的。

sentences.english: Either I succeed or I learn something. Win-Win.
sentences.chinese: 不管是关于成功还是学习某种技术，结果都是双赢的。

sentences.english: Employment units and staff to build a win-win and harmonious development of the platform.
sentences.chinese: 为用工单位与员工发展构建双赢与和谐的平台。

sentences.english: I'd like to stress that the economic and trade cooperation between China and the US is mutually-beneficial and gains win-win outcome.
sentences.chinese: 我愿意强调，中美之间的经贸合作是互利双赢的。

sentences.english: Unlike the other relationship, India- Africa relations are win-win.
sentences.chinese: 不像其他关系那样，印非关系是双赢。

sentences.english: France is ready to establish win-win cooperative partnership with China.
sentences.chinese: 法国愿同中国共同建立双赢的合作伙伴关系。

sentences.english: And both could still benefit side-by-side.
We will be dedicated for you to develop new markets, achieve a win-win situation.
sentences.chinese: 我们会尽心竭力为你们开拓市场，实现双赢。

sentences.english: I think this is a win-win deal.
sentences.chinese: 我认为这是一笔双赢的交易。

definition: lose-lose (situation)/(of the two sides involved) to both be disadvantaged
As You Like It, comedy by Shakespeare
to satisfy rival demands (idiom)/to get the best of both worlds/to have it both ways/to have one's cake and eat it too
to cooperate/to collaborate/to work together/cooperation/CL:個|个[ge4]
small capital, huge profit (idiom); to put in a little and get a lot out
What can you have against it? (idiom)/We should do this./Go for it!
